Most likely something else happens to be using port 8443: either another 
program entirely, or a previous attempted-launch of Heritrix.

On Linux, a handy way to see what program is holding a listening TCP 
port is 'netstat -l -t -p'... there's likely something similar for Windows7.

If not that, perhaps, some other failure is being misreported as a port 
conflict. There may be more info in a heritrix_out.log file where you 
attempted the launch.

- Gordon

On 9/19/12 3:41 AM, martinhuwa2012 wrote:
> I started heritrix using the console but get this:
>
>
> WARNING: It's currently not possible to run Heritrix in background
>           on Windows. It was just started minimized in a new Window
>           and will be shut down as soon as you log off.
>
> 19.09.2012 12:40:57,47 Starting heritrix
>
> Heritrix failed to start properly. Possible causes:
>
> - another program uses the port for the web inferface (8443 default)
>    (e.g. another Heritrix instance)
